reasons.exited: The bloody user buggered off from the game by typing 'quit' in the F8 console or pressing ALT and F4 or some bloody wankerish shite.
reasons.disconnected: The bloke buggered off from the server by bashing 'disconnect' in the F8 console or something.
reasons.crash: The geezer's game crashed and left a sodding error message.
reasons.timeout: The bloke's connection to the server went tits up. This usually happens when the internet goes down the shitter.
reasons.banned: Some posh staff member banned the wanker with some fanciful reason.
reasons.restart: The server kicked the pillock because it was bloody restarting.
reasons.kicked: Some wanker staff member kicked the tosser for a bloody good reason, innit.
reasons.job: The bloke's job priority expired, mate. That means the twat waited in the queue way too flaming long for the job priority, so the system chucked 'em out of the queue like a proper tosspot.
reasons.doors: The server tried to have a go at synchronizing doors with the client, but bloody hell, it failed miserably. So it kicked the plonker 'cause it couldn't recover from this right cock-up.
reasons.global: The bleeding system caught wind that the wanker was probably up to no good, so it gave 'em a grand global OP-FW ban. Rightly so, I say!
reasons.editor: The bloody wanker decided to open their sodding Rockstar Editor, which buggered off and left you stuck in this bleedin' server.
reasons.overflow: Bloody FiveM thinks it's clever and wants to protect your sorry arse from them cheating pricks who spam your server with their bleedin' events.
reasons.another: The tosser thought it'd be a brilliant idea to connect to another server without even bothering to sod off from this one first.
reasons.config: The servers configuration decided it couldn't be arsed to load properly while the user was trying to connect, so it buggered off and told them to piss off.
reasons.unknown: Can't be bothered to give you a detailed description, mate. Why don't you ask a bloody developer for some more sodding help?
